page.title: 04DINSDALE MANOR HOUSE
page.content: The Manor House at Low Dinsdale is the oldest house in our area.The present house was built in 1536 and has been added to at various dates since then. It was previously a fortified settlement and the family seat of the Surtees family, the name being taken from the River Tees. A dried up moat still survives around the house and has a bridge across it.This was the original entrance over the moat.It has carved on it the family crest of the Surtees family. This is a very ancient settlement from Danish times and a house on this site was mentioned in the First Doomsday Book as DIRNESHALE or DIGNESHALE.The building is a scheduled ancient monument.Details are kept by the Surtees Society of Antiquities in Newcastle upon Tyne
